greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(0) = 0; a(n) = tau(n^3), where tau = number of divisors (A000005).
comment: The inverse Mobius transform of A074816. - _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 09 2011
a(n) is also the number of ordered triples (i,j,k) of positive integers such that i|n, j|n, k|n and i,j,k are pairwise relatively prime. - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Jan 11 2015
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: a(n) = Sum_{d|n} 3^omega(d), where omega(x) is the number of distinct prime factors in the factorization of x. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Apr 14 2002
L.g.f.: -log(Product_{k>=1} (1 - x^k)^(3^omega(k)/k)) = Sum_{n>=1} a(n)*x^n/n. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, May 26 2018
For n>0, a(n) = Sum_{d|n} mu(d)^2*tau(d)*tau(n/d). - _Ridouane Oudra_, Nov 18 2019
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
